I assume these comments relate to my 1957 Splitscreen. When I went to purchase it, as I had no knowledge of the complexities of these vehicles consequently I took the owner of Reichspeed with me and thought I was buying a Samba in good faith. Even when I had it valued nothing was mentioned about it not being a Samba! However, since advertising it I have only just found and read all of your comments. I have made further enquiries and can confirm the following :-

1) I have the Birth Certificate from the VW Museum confirming the bus is a model 224
VW Micro Bus, right hand drive.
2) The original colours were L312 Palm Green/L311 Sand Green with Lime green upholstery.
3) It has "low hinge" cargo doors and tailgate, which is 1960-1963 (half moon recess),
fitted.
4) Seats have been re-trimmed and cab seats appear to have been mounted on new
runners and are non standard.
5) Engine - Is not the original 1.2 litre, looks to have been replaced with either a 1500
or possibly a 1600 from an early Bay.

As a genuine and honest seller, now that I am aware of these issues, I have amended my adverts and reduced my price which is now below the SSVC valuation.
My bus is a Model 224 Microbus, consequently many of the above posts are now technically incorrect, irrelevant and detrimental.
As a new member to the VW scene I would have appreciated some help and advice rather than suddenly finding derrogatory comments being posted across the worldwide web about myself and my bus.
Nevertheless, the bus is a legitimate, MOT'd, good solid bus.
It is available for anyone to view and inspect and I am open to sensible offers.
